infotext.lolife.1: The application has been developed by the Finnish Museum of Natural History Luomus in the project Flying Squirrel LIFE which is coordinated by Mets√§hallitus Parks & Wildlife Finland. The EU-funded project aims to improve conservation of the flying squirrel in the EU by improving viable habitat networks in the future.
infotext.lolife.2: The project has received funding from the LIFE Programme of the European Union. The material reflects the views by the authors, and the European Commission or the EASME is not responsible for any use that may be made of the information it contains.
infotext.mobilevihko.1: Mobile Nature Notebook is an application for saving nature observations to Finnish Biodiversity Info Faculty's observation service. Log in as a user in webpage
infotext.mobilevihko.2: The application is especially meant for tracking the path traveled in nature and writing down the most important observations. It saves the path with the help of GPS and shows it on the map. Observations can be added to the map, and basic details (such as unit count) and images can be attached to them.
infotext.mobilevihko.3: When the trip or environment work has been finished, the app saves for example, the time spent in the event. After finishing, the whole observation event is sent to Notebook-service. There one can add more observations and further details.
instructions.lolife.1: Start recording without prestored location OR select the location, which was established at Species.fi
instructions.lolife.2: Liituri starts GPS tracking automatically and stores your track.
instructions.lolife.3: Point in the map, where you want to add an observation and select the observation type from the selection that becomes visible.
instructions.lolife.4: Add new observations along the trail.
instructions.lolife.5: Edit or move an observation by selecting a point nearby the observation, after which you can select the observation that you want to edit from the menu that opens to the left.
instructions.lolife.6: Stop the observation event by touching the red square at the top right corner of the screen and you will be taken to the homepage.
instructions.lolife.7: At the bottom of the homepage, you will find the list of your unsaved events, which can be checked, amended and stored in to FinBIF data warehouse.
instructions.lolife.intro: Liituri is an observation service designed for recoding Flying squirrel observations in the field.
instructions.mobilevihko.1: Choose the form of your choice from the top of the home screen and begin observing. The trip form suits all taxon groups.
instructions.mobilevihko.2: The application tracks the traveled path automatically.
instructions.mobilevihko.3: To add an observation, long press the map in the spot where the organism is. (Don't add your own position.) To add an observation to your own position, short press the circle which shows where you are at.
instructions.mobilevihko.4: To edit an observation that's already recorded, long press the map nearby it.
instructions.mobilevihko.5: When you want to stop observing, press the red button. Then the observations are saved into your phone, but not yet elsewhere.
instructions.mobilevihko.6: You can edit the whole observation event's (trip's) details. When you save these, the application asks whether you want to send them to the Notebook-service.
instructions.mobilevihko.7: In the home page you see the observation events that you haven't sent to Notebook yet.
instructions.mobilevihko.8: After sending you can continue editing the observations in Notebook in the webpage
instructions.mobilevihko.intro: Save nature observations from all taxon groups to species.fi database.
instructions.mobilevihko.intro.fungi: With the Fungi Atlas form you can save observations to Fungi Atlas (sieniatlas.fi).
